title: N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 462.1 - Rendition, content and revision
content:
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12 ยง 462.1 - Rendition, content and revision

State Regulations
(a) The administrative law judge shall render
his decision in writing within five days after the hearing is concluded. The
decision shall contain a statement of the issues, the findings of fact, the
conclusions and the reasons therefor. (b) On his own motion or on application duly
made, the administrative law judge may revise the decision for the purpose of
correcting clerical, arithmetical or typographical errors. If the
administrative law judge is absent, disabled, disqualified or no longer
serving, the chief administrative law judge or a senior administrative law
judge may designate an administrative law judge to consider the application and
if granted, to make the necessary revision. Notes
N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 12
ยง
462.1

State regulations are updated quarterly; we currently have two versions available. Below is a
comparison between our most recent version and the prior quarterly release. More comparison features will be added as we have more versions to compare. No prior version found.
